div.head: Vpon Master De Croys Conformities, out of the FRENCH. To the Reader.
SONNET.

lg.l: AGainst the sacred Church of Christ
Sathan, hath euer stir'd vp warre:
Now Pagan-like, in strange disguise,
Most wickedly therewith did iarre.
And then sometime, euen as a Iew,
But yet with much more craft and skill,
Like a cunning hereticke toyles,
With errours grosse the Church to fill.
Since that our Sauiour left the earth,
By craftie colour of Christs name,
This Serpent lyer, most false and fine,
His Church hath practis'd to defame.
And those errours, as seede thus cast
By him into the holy ground,
Hath by degrees, growne and encreast,
And did at last spoyle and confound:
The good seed in beleeuing men;
For Antichrist his chaire hath set;
Euen in the Temple of our God,
And therein Peacocke-like doth iett.
But in De Croys Conformities,
You may his errours plainely see,
Where all his foule deformities,
To life discou'red fully bee.
